jparsec.io

Class HTMLReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.HTMLReport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class HTMLReport
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to create simple HTML files.

    The basic process is to write the header, to start the body, to end the body, and to end the document. Any text to write should be located inside the body. Anyway, the header/body and document end are handled or called automatically in case the user don't call them, so it is possible to concentrate just in the content.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • writeRowsInTable

        public void writeRowsInTable(Table table)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Writes an entire table object, row by row. Header should be written previously. The table is written using parenthesis for the error values, and without units. Parameters like background color and align are ignored.
        Parameters:
        table - The table object.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the number of dimensions in the Table is more than 2.

      • writeRowInTable

        public void writeRowInTable(java.lang.String[] columns,
                   java.lang.String bgcolor,
                   java.lang.String align,
                   java.lang.String colspan)
        Write a row in a table.

        The background color is composed by three groups of two characters in hexadecimal format, for each component red, green, and blue. 0000ff is intense blue, ff0000 is red, and so on.

        Align commands are right, left, center.

        Column span is the number of columns to be agruped by a given text. If a table has 6 columns (length of columns array), then a column span of 6 alows to write text ocuping the whole row, as a title for example. In this case the columns array should have length 1 to write only that title.

        Parameters:
        columns - Columns to be written to complete the row.
        bgcolor - Background color. Set to null to skip the command.
        align - Align command. Set to null to skip the command.
        colspan - Column span command. Set to null to skip the command.

      • writeRowInTable

        public void writeRowInTable(java.lang.String[] columns,
                   java.lang.String[] title,
                   java.lang.String bgcolor,
                   java.lang.String align,
                   java.lang.String colspan)
        Write a row in a table including a possible title (tooltip text) that appears when the mouse is on the text item.

        The background color is composed by three groups of two characters in hexadecimal format, for each component red, green, and blue. 0000ff is intense blue, ff0000 is red, and so on.

        Align commands are right, left, center.

        Column span is the number of columns to be agruped by a given text. If a table has 6 columns (length of columns array), then a column span of 6 alows to write text ocuping the whole row, as a title for example. In this case the columns array should have length 1 to write only that title.

        Parameters:
        columns - Columns to be written to complete the row.
        title - Title for the tooltip in each column item.
        bgcolor - Background color. Set to null to skip the command.
        align - Align command. Set to null to skip the command.
        colspan - Column span command. Set to null to skip the command.

      • writeComment

        public void writeComment(java.lang.String text)
                  throws JPARSECException
        Writes a comment, not visible in the resulting document.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to write.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the text style is invalid.

      • writeImage

        public java.lang.String writeImage(java.lang.String width,
                          java.lang.String height,
                          java.lang.String align,
                          java.lang.String border,
                          java.lang.String alt,
                          java.lang.String src)
        Returns the code for an image tag. The image text is not written to the html code since here is supposed that further processing is required. None of the parameters can be null.
        Parameters:
        width - Width.
        height - Height.
        align - Align.
        border - Border.
        alt - Tooltip text.
        src - Link to the image.
        Returns:
        HTML code.

      • writeImageToHTML

        public void writeImageToHTML(java.lang.String width,
                    java.lang.String height,
                    java.lang.String align,
                    java.lang.String border,
                    java.lang.String alt,
                    java.lang.String src)
        Writes the code for an image tag. None of the parameters can be null.
        Parameters:
        width - Width.
        height - Height.
        align - Align.
        border - Border.
        alt - Tooltip text.
        src - Link to the image.

      • writeImageWithCaption

        public void writeImageWithCaption(java.lang.String width,
                         java.lang.String height,
                         java.lang.String align,
                         java.lang.String src,
                         java.lang.String caption,
                         java.lang.String alt)
        Writes the code for an image tag. This methods is here to support the change from a Latex to an HTML report without issues. Caption is ignored.
        Parameters:
        width - Width.
        height - Height.
        align - Align.
        src - Link to the image.
        caption - Ignored.
        alt - Tooltip text.
